title.narrative: Revenue Administration and Revenue Policy - Guinea-Bissau. Guinea-Bissau - Revenue Policy and Adminstration. Revenue Administration and Revenue Policy -Guinea-Bissau

description.narrative: The project supports the tax administration, Direcção-geral de Contribuições e Impostos (DGCI), in streamlining and documenting audit procedures, providing training on use of procedures, and improving basic management practices. Additional activities for 2017 include implementing withholding and corporate tax return forms and accompanying instructions, developing a sales tax return form, and implementing the ministerial order on withholding of property tax.. The project supports the tax administration, Direcção-geral de Contribuições e Impostos (DGCI), in streamlining and documenting audit procedures, and providing training on use of procedures. Additional activities for 2016 include conducting an in-depth assessment of taxpayer service, developing a handbook of taxpayer service procedures and products such as brochures and a website, and providing training for employees on procedures. The project supports the tax administration, Direcção-geral de Contribuições e Impostos (DGCI), in streamlining and documenting audit procedures, and providing training on use of procedures. Additional activities for 2017 include implementing withholding and corporate tax return forms and accompanying instructions, developing a sales tax return form, and implementing the ministerial order on withholding of property tax.. The project supports the tax administration, Direcção-geral de Contribuições e Impostos (DGCI), in streamlining and documenting audit procedures, providing training on use of procedures, and improving basic management practices. Additional activities include implementing withholding and corporate tax return forms and accompanying instructions, and developing a sales tax return form.. #N/A. The project supports the tax administration, Direcção-geral de Contribuições e Impostos (DGCI), in streamlining and documenting audit procedures, and providing training on use of procedures. Additional activities for 2016 include conducting an in-depth assessment of taxpayer service, developing a handbook of taxpayer service procedures and products such as brochures and a website, and providing training for employees on procedures.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Elections in 2014 restored constitutional rule in Guinea-Bissau following the April 2012 coup d'. The new government, under the leadership of Prime Minister Domingos Sim'f5es Pereira, quickly secured support from the international community and embarked on an ambitious slate of reforms. President JosMVaz dismissed Sim'f5es Pereira's government in August 2015, and the subsequent political stalemate stalled progress of the reform program. The new government of Prime Minister Carlos Correia, established in October 2015, includes a number of ministers from the previous cabinet and will likely pursue the same reform objectives. Tensions between the government and President Vaz may resurface as a result of deep divisions within the ruling party. U.S. foreign policy goals are: support the development of a stable, democratic government; build effective government capacity to counter narcotics trafficking; and advance economic growth based on good governance and sound economic policy. FY 2017 U.S. foreign assistance to Guinea-Bissau focuses on professionalization of the country's military forces.
